H3.text: What was abolished by the Supreme Court in 1972, but reinstated in 1976. Execute

A4.text: The Supreme Court's decision in Furman v. Georgia (1972) invalidated the death penalty for rape and resulted in over 630 death sentences being vacated and reduced to life imprisonment.

A5.text: In 1976, the Supreme Court upheld new death penalty statutes in Gregg v. Georgia, which included bifurcated trials and standards for sentencing, marking a reinstatement of capital punishment under revised legal frameworks.
